summary: The Keep the Heat On Act of 2025 (H.R. 5687) addresses funding for the Low-Income Home Energy Assistance Program (LIHEAP) during a federal government shutdown. It appropriates funds from the Treasury to maintain LIHEAP payments during any lapse in discretionary appropriations in fiscal year 2026, ensuring payments continue at the same rate as the corresponding month in fiscal year 2025. The bill's aim is to protect vulnerable populations who rely on home energy assistance.
